page.title: 04EDUCATION IN GROVE.
page.content: The gifts of the Vernon family to Grove included a new Church and a Dame School. The Dame School provided for 24 children and was adjacent to the Church.The building is now a private dwelling.A much remembered Headteacher was Mrs.Crompton.The Dame School was provided principally for the children whose parents worked on the Grove Estate. The children all wore red cloaks,a sight easily remembered by the senior villagers.Shortly before the 1939/45 war,this school was replaced by a village Infants/Primary School with two classrooms.Falling numbers caused its closure in 1967. The building is now a private residence,almost opposite the Garden Centre.Village children now have private transport to attend school in Retford,four miles away.
